comments:
Build: I20021204
When launching a runtime workbench, I get the null pointer exception below.


org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException[5013]: java.lang.NullPointerException
at java.lang.Runtime.exec(Runtime.java:551)
at java.lang.Runtime.exec(Runtime.java:491)
at org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin.exec(DebugPlugin.java:482)
at org.eclipse.jdt.launching.AbstractVMRunner.exec(AbstractVMRunner.java:53)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.StandardVMDebugger.run
(StandardVMDebugger.java:181)
at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.launcher.WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.doLaun
ch(WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:299)
at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.launcher.WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.launch
(WorkbenchLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:94)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch
(LaunchConfiguration.java:144)
at 
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.LaunchConfigurationsDialog$6.
run(LaunchConfigurationsDialog.java:1239)
at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run
(ModalContext.java:95)

From the trace, it looks like you are passing in a null cmdLine to execute. Do 
you know what parameters you are passing in?

Steps to reproduce? (I am launching runtime workbenches without trouble in the 
same build). We also have not changed this code....

1. Launch Eclipse on a new workspace.
2. Go to Preferences->Target platform.  Select All.
3. Create a new runtime workbench configuration.
4. Launch it in debug mode.

The 10th pararmeter passed in (application name?) is null:

cmdLine= java.lang.String[18]  (id=38)
	[0]= "D:\\jdk1.4.1\\jre\\bin\\javaw.exe"
	[1]= "-classpath"
	[2]= "D:\\sdk20021204
\\eclipse\\startup.jar;d:\\eclipse_ws\\plugins\\org.eclipse.core.boot\\boot.jar"
	[3]= "-Xdebug"
	[4]= "-Xnoagent"
	[5]= "-Djava.compiler=NONE"
	[6]= "-Xrunjdwp:transport=dt_socket,suspend=y,address=localhost:6650"
	[7]= "org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main"
	[8]= "-application"
	[9]= null
	[10]= "-plugins"
	[11]= "file:d:\\testspaces\\empty-
space\\.metadata\\.plugins\\org.eclipse.pde.core\\D__sdk20021204_eclipse_runtime
-workspace\\plugin_path.properties"
	[12]= "-dev"
	[13]= "bin"
	[14]= "-data"
	[15]= "D:\\sdk20021204\\eclipse\\runtime-workspace"
	[16]= "-showsplash"
	[17]= "D:\\sdk20021204\\eclipse\\eclipse.exe -showsplash 600"
For some reason, the appname is not saved on the config.

This is caused by recent changes in the way default values are set and applied 
in launch configuration dialog.

It may be that the changes make a better dialog, but it would help if you 
assume that you might break the existing behaviour and inform us before the 
change. We are passing 'null' because we never got the chance to set the 
default value (in the past, 'performApply' used to be called regardless). I am 
not saying that the old way was correct (it wasn't), just that our dialog 
stopped working when you changed the behaviour.

Yes - the dialog change has caused this breakage. What can I say? It's 
unfortunate.
It's neither the first nor the last one in Eclipse until the release :-).
*** Bug 27987 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
